title: Onboarding
text:
We are primarily located and affiliated with the ANU Biological Data Science Institute, as such there are a number of shared resources.
The team uses the following shared resources:

anu-bdsi GitHub organisation for public team resources (BDSI team only)
anu-aagi GitHub organisation for public team resources (AAGI team only)
Sharepoint site for private team resources (staff only)
Microsoft teams for casual chats (any ANU staff)
Microsoft group for group emails (staff only)

title: Onboarding
text:
Principles
We advocate for open science, i.e.¬†share your code and data when and where it is reasonable to do so. The complete analysis code by default should be open (not ‚Äúavailable by request‚Äù bullcrap) unless there is a good reason not to. Of course, some data may have sensitive information then you should not share this publicly and certainly should not be done without the permission of the data collector. In this instance, we encourage you to generate synthetic data so your code can be run on the synthetic data. Where the reason for not sharing data is due to having a competitive advantage, then we suggest to pre-define an embargo period.

title: Onboarding
text:
How to get added

Send your GitHub username to Emi Tanaka for GitHub organisation.
Send your ANU email address to Jo Bayley or Emi Tanaka to be added for Sharepoint, Microsoft teams, and Microsoft group.

title: Job alert üì¢ Seeking 3 postdocs
text:
We are looking for 3 postdoctoral or research fellows with experience in statistics, data science, machine learning, bioinformatics, quantitative biology, or closely related fields. Candidates must possess strong scientific programming skills, demonstrated experience working with real data, and a substantial commitment to reproducible and transparent workflows.
The three postdocs will be part of our institute working on the ‚ÄúAnalytics for the Australian Grains Industry‚Äù project each working on one of the following topics:

Statistical design and modelling,
Bioinformatics and molecular phenotyping, or
Machine learning and image analytics.

The job application closes on Jan 19 2025 23:55 AEDT. The term of employment is up to 3 years (up to 31st December 2027).
For more details see here.

title: Analytics for the Australian Grains Industry

title: About
text: ANU-AAGI is a research collaboration with the Strategic Partners of the Analytics for the Australian Grains Industry (AAGI) funded by the Grains Research Development Coorperation (GRDC). ANU officially joined AAGI at the end of 2024.

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!
